title: What is RP module?
text:
The Research Project module at SLIIT is worth 16 credits. Students must complete this module in teams of 4, with each team having a supervisor and a co-supervisor, both SLIIT lecturers.

The project must align with a category included in the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals (UN SDGs).

Throughout the year, students are required to complete several key milestones to ensure steady progress. These milestones serve as checkpoints where students present their work, receive feedback, and adjust their approach as needed.

At the end of the project, students must deliver a well-developed product that demonstrates practical, real-world value and addresses a meaningful problem.

Supervisors and co-supervisors provide ongoing guidance and support to students throughout the project, helping them refine their ideas, troubleshoot challenges, and maintain a high standard of quality.

section.title: What are UN Sustainable Development Goals?
section.content: The UN SDGs are 17 global goals aimed at addressing issues like poverty, inequality, and climate change. In the RP module, each team must focus on a topic related to one of these goals.

section.title: Why Water Board?
section.content: The Water Board Quality Management System supports Clean Water and Sanitation. By monitoring and improving water quality, the system ensures access to safe and clean water, which is essential for public health and environmental protection.
